text: Coffee was so, so good. The baristas were friendly. Lacking the 5 star rating only because it felt a little dismal with no seating area... grab and go cause of the damn pandemic.
Was in town for business and stayed nearby. Great drip coffee and breakfast sandwich. Much better than hotel fare.

I just had the most horrible sandwich I have had in the last decade. I asked for just one thing if the sandwiches were hot. I got a lightly toasted multigrain bread with watery babaganoush leaking from it. Imagine starving and still wanting to throw your food away. The sandwich menu here needs to be killed. It's a cutesy place with coffee and pastries, but sandwiches they make are like my 3 year old makes - Hey I put a bunch of things between bread!

I was scouring the city looking for a fresh cup of coffee and when I found the menagerie I was starkly disappointed not only was I rudely treated when I tried to enter the location momentarily adjusting my mask after jogging through the city but then on top of that there was another patron who walked in who is verbally assaulted for not wearing his mask by some guy in a red beanie the guy in the red beanie was so mean so rude honestly I don't understand why you hired him.. save your money and find someone who understands humanity.
Insanely overrated. A very average latte, pastries are nothing special (like some packaged Little Debbie quality). Visited before 10am so I expected fresher stuff.

The coldbrew was indeed smooth, and affordable compared to NY and LA prices. Paid ~3.50 for a 16 ounce! Only thing I'd change; I asked for water and they said they didn't give out cups of it, only bottles of water. In the 95 degree August heat, this is a bummer.

We stopped there for coffee. The service was great, the place was clean and the food was fresh and delicious! They have a great menu.
The food was tasty and the waiter was very warm and friendly.
This is a quaint little place with so much charm. The food was very good and generous portions were served. Seating is limited but worth the wait for a table.

I met an old friend to catch up with at Menagerie. It was the day that the mask mandates and updates around COVID changed yet again and so there were no tables or chairs to sit inside, but nbd. We ordered our large cold brews with a couple scones and walked over to the park nearby. 

By far the best cold brew coffee I've had outside of the ones I make myself at home! In fact, it was so good that I went back to get another one on my way back home! Staff are friendly and they were practicing all the safety protocols. I'd definitely venture out a bit for this coffee - yes, it's that good!

Great place in old city to catch up with friends or some work. 
The coffee was very good, and there's usually a fairly decent amount of selections for pastries and sandwiches. They're nothing special but it's always good to have something to snack on while doing work.
The wifi was fairly reliable and there were lots of space, including a big table at the back, although if it's on a busy weekend, you might have to share tables with others. The bathroom was clean and there're quite a few places with outlets in case you plan on staying there for a while. 
Only complaint is that some of the areas are a bit dark. i'm someone who likes lots of natural light and well-lit spaces when i work, but the dimmer environment definitely has a more homey cozy vibe to it, which others might like.

I really wanted to like this place more because it's cute and the service is friendly, but IMHO, Elixr coffee is too harsh and bitter and the couple of pastries I tried (coffee cake muffin and oatmeal raisin cookies) were just okay. I was here a couple of days in a row on a recent visit to Philly, trying to give it another shot, but stopped coming after the third day
Super nice people work here, The only want the customer to be satisfied. Great lattes and baked goods.

I was killing time waiting for my passport at the customs house nearby and went looking for coffee. This adorable little place made me so happy- they have DECAF cold brew! I can't have caffeine and it is so hard to find iced decaf (besides espresso) anywhere. AND they had oat milk. And it was delicious. They had some delicious looking scones and other treats too! Definitely check it out if you're in Old City!

Totally respecting their in-store customer limit (we love that they're prioritising safety so much), but the matcha and chai we got left us wishing we could spend all day in there! Both drinks were perfect, especially with the use of oat milk. Finding that as an option is always a treat and it really enhanced our drinks. The staff was really courteous and prompt as well, making this possibly our best cafe stop during our trip

We love third wave coffee and always seek out local coffeehouses wherever we go. Menagerie is such a great coffeehouse with a dark rustic feel coming from the brick and natural wood. The service was excellent with them not minding that we arrived ten minutes before closing. We were happy we made it as the espresso drinks were fantastic. Look forward to a return visit next time we are in the area.

Cute little spot serving Elixr coffee, which I've enjoyed at their cafe. So on a dog walk recently, we stopped in (well, I stopped in while my husband waited outside with the dogs). Coffee was good, and I was impressed to see that that they have a kitchen with staff making the sandwiches to order. My husband got a breakfast sandwich and I got a pastry. 

I get the feeling they might have more food options when things get back to "normal." I'll be interested to try those, though they already have some good stuff on offer.

I like that they are open earlier than other spots, so I can stop in when I walk dogs and before things get busy in the neighborhood.

Cute cafe that has adapted fully to COVID. There were no chairs when I went and plexiglass separating the customers from employees.  They work super fast, very friendly, and have still managed to make the place aesthetically pleasing.
Their coffee and croissant was delish! 
I wish COVID is gone so I can enjoy an idyllic morning enjoying the cafe to its fullest soon.

Menagerie is the latest on my list of amazing places I have gotten to try outside of my typical Rittenhouse bubble. While I wish I were more of a coffee connoisseur (alas, call it my character flaw), I can definitely tell if coffee is amazing or horrible. Luckily Menagerie's coffee is AMAZING. It is delicious and refreshing. I got the iced oat milk latte and my friend similarly agreed that she loved her cold brew (which is saying something, given how simple cold brew tends to be).

We grabbed iced drinks from here and roamed amidst the historical buildings. 11/10 would recommend!

Coffee was ok, not bad, not the best. Breakfast sandwich and donut was very good! Not awesome when your husband waits in line to keep the three person limit and then gets kicked out when a customer comes back in to correct a precious order. These are not cities mandates and customer service should always be a consideration.

Very great coffee and pastries. Loved the Covid-safety protocols in place, felt very safe ordering and inside. We got a latte and a chai, as well as a cute pastry and a slice of Irish soda bread. Both drinks were amazing, the Chai specifically was really good and clearly made in-house. The soda bread was fantastically thick, and they grill-toasted it and buttered it for us. They were also quite fast and very friendly. It's also right near market street so it's easy to get to. Would recommend it as a stop.
$6 for a matcha latte that had way too much milk and not enough matcha. I've had better at Starbucks
If you're finicky about finding top quality coffee then this is your place. Best beans, great coffee, and they also do great lattes.

Small coffee shop with a selection of pastries, with a small table for 2 outside the door, and handled COVID well - ordered a chocolate croissant, cappuccino, and matcha latte.

How they're managing COVID: They were very strict on only having 2 people inside the shop at one time, and everyone had to be in masks. Had a screen around the cashier as well, and would pass over drinks & pastries through the screen. 

Food: Thought the drinks were well prepared and croissant was very flaky/crisp. However the drinks were ~$5 each, which I thought were a bit on the higher end, given the size of the drinks. 

Overall: 4/5 - I do think the prices are a bit higher than your average latte, but they were well made and had tasty pastries! Great job managing COVID too.
I'm always looking for great espresso when I'm in a new city. This did not disappoint and the customer service was excellent.
Tasty brews, fast, but cheerful and friendly service, yummy breakfasts- my go-to spot in old city for daily coffee

I stopped in this weekend and ordered a hot cider and vanilla donut. Everything was very tasty and fresh, service was quick and friendly despite walking in minutes after they opened on a Sunday Morning. I will definitely be back!

Menagerie Coffee is actually really exceptional. Good value for the money. Every single thing that I have purchased was really great and I would come back to have it again! Staff is really welcoming and will help you with everything. Probability of going back to Menagerie Coffee: 100%
Tastiest Chai I have ever had!! The flavors are spectacular and the drink is so smooth. I added a shot of espresso for an extra pick me up. Super cute store inside with plants and exposed brick.
The fact that it's open in this environment is enough to garner at least three stars. Excellent latte and breakfast sandwich -- although pricey. After tax and tip I spent over $12.

Easily accessible by street parking. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Now for the main event: the coffee was dank. The latte was simply and perfectly crafted/delicious. The cold brew also did not disappoint and was delicious. Be sure to grab a scone to pair with your coffee. A must visit for Old City - we will be back!
Wonderful small business to support in Old City. Delicious coffee every time! Can not speak to the food because I have not yet tried, but plan to order food next time.

I found out about this cafe almost a couple months ago, but I wish I had found it sooner! I come here for coffee and breakfast every Friday after dropping off my pup at school next door. My pup loves Fridays because he gets to play at school; I love Fridays because of Menagerie Coffee!
I always get the vanilla latte and breakfast sandwich with maple and cheddar, but I'm super excited to try the cold brew and latte with oat milk. The vanilla latte is at the perfect sweetness. Seriously addicting as is the breakfast sandwich. I l love the muffin because it's crunchy at first, and I love the sausages because it's not too salty or oily. Normally I get sick of sausage after a few bites because the saltiness and oiliness, but I could eat these any day! It only takes a few extra minutes so definitely worth it especially with the maple jam and cheddar cheese. Yummy and filling!
Relevant for COVID times - their produce box is the BOMB and such an easy pickup.

Wonderful cafe for a date, to study, or even just enjoy some peace and quiet.  The ambiance is dark, modern, and cozy.  I've only had their iced matcha lattes, and I love them! It's the perfect amount of sweetness.  I've had a few of their macarons and they were good.  Just wish they were a little cheaper. I gave this place only 4 stars only because I wish they had more options in terms of food.  Other than that, I'm all for it!

Popped in here while doing the Old City tour!

Great little find along the historic mall district. The facade is vintage and rustic. Everything is a bit hippy dippy but definitely appeals to senses and sensibilities.

More long than wide, the counter meets you on left and the baristas are very friendly and willing to help explain the different blends and roasts. Towards the back there's seating available for mostly small groups. 

The coffees are all drip and they have small plates for food/pastries. 

It's a cute spot for a treat but definitely on the expensive side - so I don't think this can be my daily coffee joint. The vibe is more sit and sip versus grab and go. 

Enjoy your time and treat yo'self!

Really loved this little coffee shop! I got a latte and my friend got a hot chocolate. Both were great. The employees were wonderful as well. There's some seating up front and more in the back. It's quieter than a Starbucks which is great (the coffee is also significantly better). It's a little out of the way for me as I don't live in Old City, but I can see myself stopping by regardless.

Nice cute neighborhood cafe. Clean and spacious. Unfortunately it's is very pricy (we are talking more expensive than Starbucks) and the matcha latte I ordered was so sweet that I wasn't able to taste the flavor of the matcha at all. Was not asked if I wanted my matcha sweet or unsweetened, probably because they are using a pre-made powder and NOT a proper matcha. For 5$ I would have expected more

A fantastic selectIon of pour over options. I would go out of my way to come back here. 

Very comfortable coffee shop vibe with ample seating, elbow room, and atmosphere. 

Highly recommended!
I have to give them a shoutout for best cappuccino I've had in a long time. It was perfect really. And the test of a good barista is the skill in making a cappuccino.

My friend and I both got the hot chocolate. We were charged $4 each for what was just cheap hot chocolate mix (probably Swiss Miss) in frothed milk. What a rip-off. The only reason I'm giving 2 stars is that this place had nice ambiance.
Great coffee! Had a latte which was made to perfection and my husband had the drip which he enjoyed. Quiet setting, cool vibe.

The staff here are not friendly or even polite. No one says hello, and they act almost annoyed that they have to take your order. I stayed close by for a week and stopped here every morning but If I lived here, I'd avoid this place like the plague. The house coffee was bitter and not that enjoyable.

Barista over poured my coffee cup and I spilt a significant amount getting to my seat. Expensive breakfast sandwich. $10 for a tiny pour over and  small English muffin breakfast sandwich. It was all delicious though. My complaints are the over poured and how expensive it is.

Had the special turmeric latte. It was ok, too strong on the turmeric for my liking. The accompanying ginger cookie was quite good though. The place is a bit smallish but located in center city which doesn't have a whole lot of coffee shops. Good place to spend some time enjoying your coffee but maybe too cramped to spend hours working without distractions.
Nice place to grab a coffee with friends or even get some work done, there are plenty of outlets around and the jazz music is peaceful!!

The cafe has a decent amount of sitting room. I got a lot of studying done here so the atmosphere is definitely conducive to getting a lot of work done if you like cafe studying. 

They do have wifi, but I feel like they have a lot of sites blocked. I couldn't even access my school's student portal, but google and Wikipedia and scholarly sites loaded just fine. Facebook worked, but reddit and Instagram didn't. I just used my phone to set up a hotspot after a while because it was frustrating to use. 

Coffee was great, they serve elixir coffee. They have oat milk. Staff is friendly enough, nothing above and beyond. 

If the wifi wasn't such a hassle, I would totally come back. But I need a solid wifi connection to watch lectures and study, so i likely won't come back to study, but it's a nice spot to do other stuff not requiring wifi!

So I've been in the neighborhood here for 15 years and I decided to come check out the new coffee place (at least new to me ) and I must say the coffee is good the only thing that I'm curious about is why they don't have recycling? the vibe in the place is very earth friendly it seems to me with plants and the wood seats but I think having recyclable containers would be a benefit to the environment
Best cold brew ever, very filling breakfast sandwich and great seating especially in the morning. Good vibes for reading or chatting with a friend.

Very cute location, and coffee was excellent! I'm a big customer service lover since I work in the industry as well and this place could honestly do a little better. I had never been here before yet I felt rushed to order and had to ask and then answer my own questions as the barista taking our order seemed disinterested.

Worst service with sarcasm. I tried to explain I wanted cold brew with some honey and that the honey would have to be diluted in hot water or coffee before adding to cold brew. with sarcasm she said "don't worry (wtf look). When I received my cold brew there was solid honey. I brought it to her attention she apologized sarcastically and did it herself and asked me to wait somewhere. I said "that's why if add honey to a cold beverage it solidifies and the reason I asked for it in that manner." She replied sarcastically again "that is right that's how honey works."

A delightfully unpretentious coffee shop serving top notch coffee selections... great bagels... delicious sandwiches... all at reasonable prices and in a relaxing atmosphere.
You have drip and single pour options (for those with selective taste). 
You can hang out at the shop with your iPad or lap top. There is a nice friendly mix of locals. 
Or you can get take out and wonder the streets of Old City.
